paragraphs.text: Ferguson: Obama contines to undermine police departments around the country.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: As a response to the police shooting of Michael Brown, President Obama proposes $263 million for police training and body cameras
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But more police training wouldn't have prevented the Brown shooting and the president's proposal plays into the hands of those who blame the police
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama has continually undermined police departments around the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his demand for more training fits that pattern
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2009, he jumped to the conclusion that Cambridge, Massachusetts police "acted stupidly" when they arrested Henry Gates
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He personalized the Trayvon Martin investigation in a way that to many implied the murder was radically motivated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: again last week, he emphasized that the anger to the verdict was "an understandable reaction" and blacks' distrust of police is "rooted in realities."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Nevertheless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whatever Obama implies, there was absolutely no evidence Officer Darren Wilson was motivated by race
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he did exactly what he should have done
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Brown's robbery of the convenience store, his decision to reach into the police car and punch Wilson while trying to take his gun, and finally Brown's decision to charge Wilson was what caused the teen's death
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Under Missouri law, people can defend themselves with deadly force if they have a "reasonable belief" they need to use it to protect themselves against serious injury or death
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Wilson claimed:"I felt that another of those punches in my face could knock me out or worse... I've already taken two to the face and I didn't think I would, the third one could be fatal if he hit me right."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: When Brown later charged Wilson, despite repeated warnings to stop, Wilson worried that he no choice but to shoot Brown
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But we don't have to take Wilson's word for what happened
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The forensic evidence is overwhelmingly consistent with his story
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no doubt that Brown reached in Wilson's car and hit him
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Brown's DNA was found on Wilson's gun
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite strong social pressure, three black witnesses confirmed Wilson's testimony
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Police officers in America have a more dangerous job than many people realize
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they behave remarkably well under these circumstances
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2013, the assault rate for the general public in the United States was 229 per 100,000 people
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the rate police were assaulted that year was 9,300 per 100,000 officers- a rate 41 times higher
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The only reason that police don't die at as high of a rate as people in other professions is because of their training and the fact that they are armed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Would you consider it "dangerous" to live in Detroit?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it has by far the highest assault rate in the country, at 1,257 per 100,000 people
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: But police are still 7.4 times more likely to be assaulted(=9,300/1,257)
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Aggravated assaults don't necessarily involve injuries, just the attempt to cause serious bodily injury
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: police are injured at a very high rate - 2,700 per 100,000 police officer
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: That is still much higher than the total assault data for civilians
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: This data also suggests that police are not actively looking for excuses to fire their weapons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The number of justifiable killings by police equals less than one percent of the assaults on police
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Thus even
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when assaulted, police rarely resort to killing their attackers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Ferguson is showing us, physical risks aren't the only risks that police face
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On Saturday Officer Darren Wilson resigned from the Ferguson police department
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: fearing that protestors would use his continued presence to justify rioting
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He is going to have a hard time getting a job
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he didn't get any severance pay
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Who will hire him now?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Surely no other police department will hire him
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And, any company that would hire Wilson would fear the same protests
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With Wilson facing civil suits and Attorney General Eric Holder's federal investigation still ongoing, the pressures on Officer Wilson are not likely to fade away anytime soon
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's safe to say that other police officers will be carefully watching what happens to Wilson
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes, racism is despicable
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And there have been abuses by police in the past
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But 2014 isn't 1960
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Police have a difficult and dangerous job
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: President Obama could help to calm things down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he and his administration weren't so quick to assume that police officers are the only ones at fault
paragraphs.label: assumption
